alert.note: Alert for Ramsey (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 2:26PM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: .Flood waters have receded in Towner, Benson and the western part of Ramsey counties. Although the flood waters have receded, some roads may remain closed due to being washed out. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast North Dakota, including the following counties, Nelson, Ramsey and Walsh. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 226 PM CDT, Local law enforcement reported ongoing flooding across the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Edmore, Adams, Starkweather, Lankin, Dahlen, Brocket, Hampden, Webster, Fairdale, Lawton, Southam, Whitman, Garske and Derrick.
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
